questions.question: What is the defining characteristic of a sequential logic circuit compared to a combinational logic circuit?
options: Its output depends solely on its current inputs.
It always contains an internal clock generator.
Its output depends on its current inputs and its past inputs (or internal state).
It can only implement arithmetic operations.
It does not require any form of synchronization.

questions.question: In a CPU cache, which replacement policy aims to discard the cache line that has not been accessed for the longest period of time?
options: First-In, First-Out (FIFO)
Least Recently Used (LRU)
Most Recently Used (MRU)
Random Replacement
Optimal Replacement (Belady's algorithm)

questions.question: During the physical design verification phase of an integrated circuit, what is the primary purpose of performing a "Layout Versus Schematic" (LVS) check?
options: To ensure all geometric shapes in the layout adhere to manufacturing rules (e.g., width, spacing).
To verify that the physical layout implementation precisely matches the logical netlist (schematic).
To analyze the power distribution network for voltage drops (IR drop).
To identify potential electromigration issues in metal interconnects.
To estimate the propagation delays and timing paths of the circuit.

questions.question: Which architectural approach allows a single instruction to operate simultaneously on multiple data elements, typically found in multimedia processing or scientific computing?
options: Multiple Instruction, Multiple Data (MIMD)
Single Instruction, Multiple Data (SIMD)
Multiple Instruction, Single Data (MISD)
Single Instruction, Single Data (SISD)
Very Long Instruction Word (VLIW)

questions.question: In the digital IC design flow, what is a "netlist" primarily used to represent?
options: The physical dimensions and locations of all transistors and interconnects on the chip.
A high-level behavioral description of the circuit's functionality using a Hardware Description Language (HDL).
The logical connectivity and instantiation of gates, flip-flops, and other components, without physical layout information.
A set of input test patterns and expected outputs for functional simulation.
The estimated power consumption and thermal profile of the integrated circuit.
